cr.title: Early Access to Vocational Rehabilitation and Employment Benefits Act
cr.excerpt: Mr. Speaker, again, I would like to urge the passage of H.R. 2239. I appreciate the work of my chairman and ranking member and especially the work of the staff on this bill. Mr. Speaker, I yield back the balance of my time.

This commends Ethiopia's contribution to peace and stability on the African continent and recognizes the longstanding relationship between Ethiopia and...

cr.title: Milo C. Huempfner Department of Veterans Affairs Outpatient Clinic
cr.excerpt: Mr. Speaker, H.R. 2408, a bill to designate the VA outpatient clinic in Green Bay, Wisconsin as the Milo Huempfner Department of Veterans Affairs Outpatient Clinic would honor an individual whose demeanor during combat in World War II exemplifies the concept of the army of one. In 1944, Private First Class Huempfner was stranded in the...

cr.title: Passing Along Concerns of High Fuel Prices from Arkansas' Third District Residents
cr.excerpt: Mr. Speaker, earlier this month, I spent an afternoon at JV Manufacturing in Springdale, Arkansas, listening to hardworking Arkansans talk about how the high price of gas is affecting their families. I promised them that I would bring their stories back to Washington and that I would put pressure on Congress to enact a commonsense energy policy ...

cr.title: Establishing the House Democracy Assistance Commission For the 110th Congress
cr.excerpt: Madam Speaker, I rise today in strong support of House Resolution 24 to reauthorize the House Democracy Assistance Commission. This type of parliamentary development program was initially seen as a tool to help 12 emerging democracies rise from the grasp of communism in Central and Eastern Europe in the mid-1990s. We are sitting here and you always want to do your best on the pronunciation of names, and it is sad we don't know these...

cr.title: Iraq War Resolution
cr.excerpt: Mr. Speaker, I rise tonight to ask my colleagues to vote against House Concurrent Resolution 63. I ask this despite the fact that I am very much in favor of the first part of the resolution before us. The first part says: Congress will and should continue to support and protect the members of the United States Armed Forces who are serving or...
